result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah Marie Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah Marie Armstrong is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sarah Marie Armstrong was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Sarah Marie Armstrong was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Jail time currently serving

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.
The defendant must participate in Anger Management program.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time. 

Eligible for community service under 971.03(3).

Remaining costs to be paid within 60 days or commitment will be issued.
Concurrent with: Count 2

All other conditions the same as count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1 and consecutive to jail time currently serving.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time.

Eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Concurrent with: Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah Marie Armstrong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sarah Marie Armstrong in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sarah Marie Armstrong in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:52 PM. State - have revocation paperwork - mututally agree that the defendant has credit of 110 days that she is entitled to. Joy - has revocation summary - no errors or ommissions. State - makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 180 days on count #1 and 90 days on count #2 - concurrent to each other with credit for 110 days. Joy - makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 125 days jail total. Armstrong makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count 1 - 160 days in Forest County jail; count #2 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to count #1 - credit for 110 days - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), remaining costs to be paid within 60 days/CO, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 45 days of Jail added as a condition, without huber privileges

Called at 2:04 PM. Sarah Armstrong appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - have complied with victim notification requirements - amend Information #1 to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1) - reads new penalties/charge, amend #2 to DC contrary to 947.01(1) - reads new penalties/charge, pleads G to amended #1 and #2, dismiss #3, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years, consecutive to jail time she is currently serving, with conditions of: costs on each count, no other conditions. Joy and Armstrong agree. Court amends count #1 to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1) - reads new charge and penalty - pleads G. Court amends count #2 to disorderly conduct contraty to 947.01(1) - reads new charge and penalty - pleads G. Court dismsses count #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Joy - follow joint recommendation. Armstrong makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other but consecutive to current jail sentence she is serving - with conditions of: costs on each count - paid thru probation, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, AODA, particpate in anger managment program, right to appeal, #2 - 50 hours of community service to be completed within the first 6 months of probation, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on December 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 10:40 AM. Sarah Armstrong appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State - have filed Information that mirrors complaint as believes the PH is being waived. Joy and Armstrong agree. Joy provides court with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Joy has Information that mirrors complaint, will proceed to ARGN, waives reading of Information, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 12/3/14 at 1:15 PM.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy AC

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Called at 8:56 AM. Also called 13CF114. Sarah Armstrong appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State - on 14CF100 - here for INIT. Joy has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant, defendant did have a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Armstrong understands charges and penalties. Joy waives further reading, requests PH, ask for signature bond. State - bond - $5000.00 signature bond as she will be incarcerated after today's date. Court vacates warrant, continues previously ordered $2000.00 signature bond with same conditions. Joy will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 9/22/14 at 8:30 AM.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 3, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Attorney Jeffery Arthur Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:33 pm. Also calling 14CF100. No appearance by Sarah Armstrong. Joy makes statement cases were resolved. Joy indicates possible charges in Vilas Co against her significant other and believed she was going to be here. State makes statement frustrated by her non-appearance. Asks for warrant to go in effect at the end of the day and forfeit all bond. Court forfeit bonds - B/W $3000 on each case.
